intro: Galeobdolon luteum, commonly known as the yellow galeobdolon, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters, typically from late spring to early summer. Galeobdolon luteum is often found in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. It is also known for its aromatic properties and has been used in traditional herbal medicine.
